title: Claude Code 2.1 - Major Release with 1,096 Commits
description: Massive update introducing 16 major changes including multi-tasking parallel capabilities (Ctrl+B for background tasks), Skills system enhancements with automatic hot-reloading, Shift+Enter for newlines, Chrome integration (beta), sub-agents, improved Vim motions, multilingual support, and enhanced agent lifecycle control. Version 2.1.1 shipped shortly after with 109 CLI refinements.

community_feedback.quote: Hot-reload for Skills (no more restarts needed!), Context forking for parallel work, Lifecycle hooks for improved automation. The initial 2.1.0 release had some issues, but 2.1.1 smoothed them out
Claude Code is all you need...Claude is often preferred over other models for coding tasks
Pro subscriber reported hitting usage limits quickly after updating to 2.1.7

title: GitHub Copilot CLI - Enhanced Agents and Context Management
description: Major update introducing new GPT-5 mini and GPT-4.1 models included with Copilot subscription, built-in custom agents (Explore, Task, Plan, Code-review), enhanced context management with auto-compaction at 95% token limit, new installation methods via WinGet and Homebrew, automation flags for CI/CD (--silent, --share), and tab completion improvements.

community_feedback.quote: Copilot CLI is ultra simple and minimalist compared to Claude Code

title: Cursor CLI Update - New Controls and Performance Improvements
description: CLI update introducing new commands for models, MCP management, and rules (agent models, /rules, /mcp enable/disable), major hooks performance improvements (now 10-20x faster), layout customization with four default layouts (agent, editor, zen, browser), and Command+Option+Tab to switch between workspaces. Also includes enterprise features like conversation insights, billing groups, Linux sandboxing for agents, and service accounts.

title: Windsurf 1.13.6 - Agent Skills Support
description: Windsurf now supports Agent Skills for Cascade, enabling enhanced agent capabilities. This release focuses on various bug fixes and performance improvements, improved stability and reliability. The previous 1.13.5 release added Gemini 3 Flash for all users, combining Pro-grade reasoning with Flash-level speed.

community_feedback.quote: Windsurf is actually great. The best and most reliable for editing multiple files hands down and knows the context better
Honestly the differential in cursor is way better and agent review is pretty top-notch VS Code just isn't on par unfortunately
Claude Skills are awesome, maybe a bigger deal than MCP

title: Gemini CLI v0.23.0 - Experimental Agent Skills Support
description: Preview release adding experimental Agent Skills support, Windows clipboard image support (Alt+V), terminal background color detection for accessibility, and new /logout command. Also introduced gemini-wrapped for visualizing usage stats. Previous v0.22.0 opened Gemini 3 Pro & Flash to free users and added Conductor and Endor Labs extensions.

title: Devin Enterprise Features and Infosys Partnership
description: New features include Session Insights for analyzing coding sessions with actionable tips, Interactive Planning for better collaboration, Devin Search, and Devin Wiki knowledge base. Major enterprise announcement: Infosys strategic partnership (January 7, 2026) to deploy Devin across Infosys's engineering ecosystem and client engagements worldwide.

title: Continue 1.39.0 - Bug Fixes and Workflow Improvements
description: Version 1.39.0 release focusing on bug fixes including GH_TOKEN addition to continue-agents workflow (closing issue #9493) and fixing circular dependency by extracting tool names. Recent updates emphasize less setup, less context switching, and more automation driven directly from workflow.
